President Donald Trump labeled recent protests in Hong Kong as “riots,” adopting the language used by Chinese authorities and suggesting the U.S. would stay out of an issue that was “between Hong Kong and China.”

“Something is probably happening with Hong Kong, because when you look at, you know, what’s going on, they’ve had riots for a long period of time,” Trump told reporters at the White House on Thursday before departing for a campaign rally in Cincinnati.

He said he doesn’t know what China’s attitude is on the matter. “Somebody said that at some point they’re going to want to stop that,” Trump said. “But that’s between Hong Kong and that’s between China, because Hong Kong is a part of China.”

President Donald Trump labeled recent protests in Hong Kong as “riots,” adopting the language used by Chinese authorities and suggesting the U.S. would stay out of an issue that was “between Hong Kong and China.”

“Something is probably happening with Hong Kong, because when you look at, you know, what’s going on, they’ve had riots for a long period of time,” Trump told reporters at the White House on Thursday before departing for a campaign rally in Cincinnati.

He said he doesn’t know what China’s attitude is on the matter. “Somebody said that at some point they’re going to want to stop that,” Trump said. “But that’s between Hong Kong and that’s between China, because Hong Kong is a part of China.”

Krystian Bielik since joining Arsenal from Legia Warsaw for £2.4m in January 2015:

January 2017: Six-month loan at Birmingham
January 2018: Six-month loan at Walsall
2018/19: Season-long loan at Charlton
2019/20: Joins Derby County on a permanent deal for a reported £10m fee

Takuma Asano since signing for Arsenal from Sanfrecce Hiroshima for £3.5m in July 2016:

2016/17: Season-long loan at Stuttgart.
2017/18: Season-long loan at Stuttgart.
2018/19: Season-long loan at Hannover 96.
2019/20: Permanent move to Partizan Belgrade for £1m.
